Bug.WithOutStack: When I create a project there are problems with the structure and it is causing our wizard to crash. This is blocking as we cant complete our own testing. The fix is in StructureEdit class. You can load it from head to test it in dev or test it in the next IBuild Closing.

Bug.Summery: Usability
Bug.WithStack:
hi
i tried most of the gui builder for eclipse and some other ide most gui builder for eclipse are hard to use if we compare it to: netbean, jbuilder, delphi, visual...
the best gui builder i found for eclipse is: jigloo it very fast and create a gui with it is very easy, we don't need to know nothing about java gui
we can create a gui doing drag and drop, i think the layout used for that is : AnchorLayout
this layout should be in ve
another + for jigoo, when we start jigloo under eclipse, eclipse ide continue to have fast reaction...
when we start ve, eclipse begin to be very slow
my 2 cent thanks Marc, Thanks for your input regarding the use of the Visual Editor. We are always looking for ways to improve the user experience.
The AnchorLayout is a proprietory layout created by jigloo (Cloud Garden) and if you created an application using jigloo, you would have to ship it's runtime with the application in order to use it's proprietory classes.
VE generates code for AWT/Swing which doesn't require a separate runtime... only the JRE.
There is a similar layout for SWT applications that is called FormLayout which allows you to position controls relative to other controls using a constraint class called FormAttachment. This is something VE will provide better support for in the near future as we add more capability to our SWT implementation.
For Swing applications, in JRE 1.4, a SpringLayout was added which is might provide some capability similar to the anchor layout... so you may want to take a look at using it if you don't want ship jigloo's runtime with your finished application.
Bug.WithOutStack:
hi
i tried most of the gui builder for eclipse and some other ide most gui builder for eclipse are hard to use if we compare it to: netbean, jbuilder, delphi, visual...
the best gui builder i found for eclipse is: jigloo it very fast and create a gui with it is very easy, we don't need to know nothing about java gui
we can create a gui doing drag and drop, i think the layout used for that is : AnchorLayout
this layout should be in ve
another + for jigoo, when we start jigloo under eclipse, eclipse ide continue to have fast reaction...
when we start ve, eclipse begin to be very slow
my 2 cent thanks Marc, Thanks for your input regarding the use of the Visual Editor. We are always looking for ways to improve the user experience.
The AnchorLayout is a proprietory layout created by jigloo (Cloud Garden) and if you created an application using jigloo, you would have to ship it's runtime with the application in order to use it's proprietory classes.
VE generates code for AWT/Swing which doesn't require a separate runtime... only the JRE.
There is a similar layout for SWT applications that is called FormLayout which allows you to position controls relative to other controls using a constraint class called FormAttachment. This is something VE will provide better support for in the near future as we add more capability to our SWT implementation.
For Swing applications, in JRE 1.4, a SpringLayout was added which is might provide some capability similar to the anchor layout... so you may want to take a look at using it if you don't want ship jigloo's runtime with your finished application.

Bug.Summery: Sometimes UI hangs with a dialog stating that an error has occurred
Bug.WithStack:
This is related to my previous bug reports: see bug #88623 which was marked a duplicate of bug #86177 (fixed).
This is the report for variant 1 crash described in #88623.
I now use Eclipse 3.1M6 + CDT 3.1M6 + WTP 1.0 (I20050422).
My first report was aimed generically at the Platform product, but I somehow managed to track it down to the Ant editor (at least it seems to me).
The description of variant 1 in bug #88623 is still valid, but It seems that the bug is triggered while editing an Ant file with the Ant editor. More specifically: sometimes, when saving the Ant editor content and very quickly thereafter trying to run a target from the Ant view, the bug triggers.

Adding full log file for the bug just reported. From the stack traces that you have provided this is my interpretation:
The AntSecurityException is thrown in M6 if a system property is attempted to be set from the AntEditor or during a ...see bug 60860.
when you application runs out of handles this is an indication that some OS resources are not getting correctly freed during the lifecycle of the application. It is very rarely the case that it is actually the current code running that is actually causing the problem...it just happens to be the unlucky code that asks for a new handle can that fails. I have profiled the AntEditor many many times for leakage / resource problems and have not found problems in the recent past.
I have never seen these problems but I do not work with CDT or WTP.
I am sorry but I don't know what I could do in Ant land. Marking as later for future investigation. (In reply to comment #3) > Marking as later for future investigation.
Thank you very much Darin.
I don't think it depends on CDT, since the previous bug reports I filed were related to an eclipse installation without CDT.
The suspect may be WTP, then, because I've been using it for a couple of months, (also in previous builds) and this bug never showed up before. I admit it's a bit erratic in its showing up, and it never happened to me again since I installed WTP1.0M4, but it's too soon to say.
I use no other plugin and the bug seems to show up only while editing, more precisely when I try to switch focus between the Ant editor and another view (Ant or Outline views come to my mind), but I cannot say for sure, because I've been doing much less Java coding lately.
Perhaps it's worth mentioning that sometimes the bug showed up after a fresh start of eclipse and some run of simple ant buildfiles (using just standard ant tasks such copy, delete and the like), maybe (but I'm only guessing here) it's Ant itself which may be leaky in some circumstances (I extensively use the new macrodef task), assuming it runs in the same VM as eclipse (otherwise it shouldn't interfere with eclipse, am I wrong?).
Anyway I'll try to keep an eye on it, but if it is actually a leakage problem, maybe it's better to wait for the WTP code to stabilize more (It stills shows performance and efficiency problems and some leakage is not to be ruled out altogehter, I think).
We'll see.
In any case, sorry if I posted to the wrong list but, as I said, It really seemed to be somehow Ant-related.
Thanks again.
As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
This is related to my previous bug reports: see bug #88623 which was marked a duplicate of bug #86177 (fixed).
This is the report for variant 1 crash described in #88623.
I now use Eclipse 3.1M6 + CDT 3.1M6 + WTP 1.0 (I20050422).
My first report was aimed generically at the Platform product, but I somehow managed to track it down to the Ant editor (at least it seems to me).
The description of variant 1 in bug #88623 is still valid, but It seems that the bug is triggered while editing an Ant file with the Ant editor. More specifically: sometimes, when saving the Ant editor content and very quickly thereafter trying to run a target from the Ant view, the bug triggers.
The last two stack traces in the log file is the following, but there are many more like these in the log file (already in reverse order, i.e. most recent first):
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-04-26 16:13:47.285 !MESSAGE Application error !STACK 1
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2005-04-26 16:13:43.249 !MESSAGE No more handles !STACK 0

Bug.Summery: [Markers] Problems view is empty
Bug.WithStack:
build i0426-0849
I started this build and when I checked my problems view, it was empty. (0 columns)
The scrollbar looked like there was a lot of hits but nothing visible. (although I could scroll)
I turned off all filters to ensure that something should appear but nothing did.
Same thing on reset. Nothing in the log file.
Will attach screenshot. Created attachment 20364 problems with the problems view Created attachment 20458 workbench.xml
Here is my workbench.xml file. Note that all of the column widths are 0.
When I open a new workbench window, the new problems view is ok. I will open a new window and close my old one so I can continue working. I don't know what happened but I am in this state again in my new cloned window. All the column widhts are set to 0. Me too. I have also got this on 20050427 Marking M7 so this one gets tracked. Also see Bug 86329 and Bug 93488.
For me, the problems view has been appearing with incorrect sizes for quite some time, and the error log has been appearing empty for quite some time. The problems view has only started appearing empty recently. I've started actively looking at this bug. To reproduce in a self-hosted workspace, just copy "<outerWorkspace>/.metatdata/.plugins/org.eclipse.ui.workbench/*" to the inner workspace. I'm fairly confident now that this bug is a duplicate of Bug 86329.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 86329 *** *** Bug 93566 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

When I open a new workbench window, the new problems view is ok. I will open a new window and close my old one so I can continue working. I don't know what happened but I am in this state again in my new cloned window. All the column widhts are set to 0. Me too. I have also got this on 20050427 Marking M7 so this one gets tracked. Also see Bug 86329 and Bug 93488.
For me, the problems view has been appearing with incorrect sizes for quite some time, and the error log has been appearing empty for quite some time. The problems view has only started appearing empty recently. I've started actively looking at this bug. To reproduce in a self-hosted workspace, just copy "<outerWorkspace>/.metatdata/.plugins/org.eclipse.ui.workbench/*" to the inner workspace. I'm fairly confident now that this bug is a duplicate of Bug 86329.

Bug.Summery: wrong override proposal in anonymous class
[IBinding] openDeclaration on IASTName causes ClassCastException (shapes demo)
Capabilties doc issues
Bug.WithStack:
Some issues that should be addressed in the developer documentation:
if you provide a custom implementation of ITriggerPointAdvisor, you should either ensure it's compatible with the default preference page (if you intend on including it) or you should create your own preference page.
the capabilties preference page is now defined in the product plugin, not the ide plugin. If you're an RCP/application developer that that wishes the preference page included you will need to create your own declaration for it in your plugins.
Andrea, please contact me if you have any questions...
Bug.WithOutStack:
Some issues that should be addressed in the developer documentation:
if you provide a custom implementation of ITriggerPointAdvisor, you should either ensure it's compatible with the default preference page (if you intend on including it) or you should create your own preference page.
the capabilties preference page is now defined in the product plugin, not the ide plugin. If you're an RCP/application developer that that wishes the preference page included you will need to create your own declaration for it in your plugins.
Andrea, please contact me if you have any questions...

Bug.Summery: [find/replace] Clicking Replace/Find button goes beyond scope
Bug.WithStack:
I would like to change "left" to "right" within a selected range of text only.
Currently, there seems to be a bug with invoking Find/Replace with selected text. As you press Find/Replace on the dialog, the found text is not highlighted or selected. Instead, the previous selection range is maintained. The result is that replacements are made which are hard to see and could be unintended. This works for me in I20050420-1200 by using the 'Selected Lines' scope. Please provide a more detailed scenario that does not work for you. Try pressing the incremental button (Find/Replace) instead of Replace All. The dialog beeps as if it did nothing, but it continues to replace text outside of the selected range. This is a good catch! Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds > N20060103-0010. Bug in comment 4: >Available in builds > N20060103-0010. should be: Available in builds > N20060403-0010.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I would like to change "left" to "right" within a selected range of text only.
Currently, there seems to be a bug with invoking Find/Replace with selected text. As you press Find/Replace on the dialog, the found text is not highlighted or selected. Instead, the previous selection range is maintained. The result is that replacements are made which are hard to see and could be unintended. This works for me in I20050420-1200 by using the 'Selected Lines' scope. Please provide a more detailed scenario that does not work for you. Try pressing the incremental button (Find/Replace) instead of Replace All. The dialog beeps as if it did nothing, but it continues to replace text outside of the selected range. This is a good catch! Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds > N20060103-0010. Bug in comment 4: >Available in builds > N20060103-0010. should be: Available in builds > N20060403-0010.

Bug.Summery: Cannot start eclipse

Lines.Line: - startup runtime
- launch workspace chooser
- access PreferencesService class
- initialize the modify listeners
- new debug modify listener is in jdt-launching plug-in which requires
core.resources
- core.resources is started
- instance location hasn't been set yet so it dies

Bug.WithStack:
I20050426-0849
I am presented with the workspace chooser dialog, but no matter what I choose for my workspace, I get a dialog which says:
Workspace Cannot be Set
Error in runtime; workspace cannot be set. Exiting.
Although it creates the directory for a new workspace, it contains no .metadata and no .log. Using -consoleLog doesn't give anything more either:
!SESSION 2005-04-26 11:03:08.431 -----------------------------------------------eclipse.buildId=I20050426-0849 java.version=1.4.2_06 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US Command-line arguments: -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -clean -debug -consoleLog
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 2 10035 2005-04-26 11:03:11.671 !MESSAGE A workspace crash was detected. The previous session did not exit normally.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2 1 2005-04-26 11:03:11.836 !MESSAGE NLS unused message: TeamPlugin_setting_global_ignore_7 in: org.eclipse.team.internal.core.messages Works with -data. Could reproduce on Windows as well. What is happening: - startup runtime - launch workspace chooser - access PreferencesService class - initialize the modify listeners - new debug modify listener is in jdt-launching plug-in which requires core.resources - core.resources is started - instance location hasn't been set yet so it dies
I have deferred the creation of the modify listeners until after the instance location has been set.
Fix released to HEAD. Will request a re-build.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20050426-0849
I am presented with the workspace chooser dialog, but no matter what I choose for my workspace, I get a dialog which says:
Workspace Cannot be Set
Error in runtime; workspace cannot be set. Exiting.
Although it creates the directory for a new workspace, it contains no .metadata and no .log. Using -consoleLog doesn't give anything more either:
!SESSION 2005-04-26 11:03:08.431 -----------------------------------------------eclipse.buildId=I20050426-0849 java.version=1.4.2_06 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US Command-line arguments: -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -clean -debug -consoleLog
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 2 10035 2005-04-26 11:03:11.671 !MESSAGE A workspace crash was detected. The previous session did not exit normally.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2 1 2005-04-26 11:03:11.836 !MESSAGE NLS unused message: TeamPlugin_setting_global_ignore_7 in: org.eclipse.team.internal.core.messages Works with -data. Could reproduce on Windows as well. What is happening: - startup runtime - launch workspace chooser - access PreferencesService class - initialize the modify listeners - new debug modify listener is in jdt-launching plug-in which requires core.resources - core.resources is started - instance location hasn't been set yet so it dies
I have deferred the creation of the modify listeners until after the instance location has been set.
Fix released to HEAD. Will request a re-build.

Bug.Summery: [Contributions] Spec clarification: ContributionItem.getParent() can return null

source_code.code: /** * Returns the parent contribution manager. * * @return the parent contribution manager * @since 2.0 */

/** * Returns the parent contribution manager, or null if this contribution * item is not currently added to a contribution manager. * * @return the parent contribution manager, or null * @since 2.0 */

Bug.WithStack: build I20050420 ContributionItem.getParent() is spec'ed to not return null: /** * Returns the parent contribution manager. * * @return the parent contribution manager * @since 2.0 */ public IContributionManager getParent() ... However, it can return null if the item has not yet been added to a contribution manager (this has always been true), or after it has been removed from the manager (true since 3.1 due to fix for bug 80569). Need to change the spec to clarify that it can return null. /** * Returns the parent contribution manager, or null if this contribution * item is not currently added to a contribution manager. * * @return the parent contribution manager, or null * @since 2.0 */ Added the following to the porting guide: ContributionItem.getParent() can return null What is affected: Plug-ins that call getParent() on a subclass of org.eclipse.jface.action.ContributionItem. Description: In Eclipse 3.0, method org.eclipse.jface.action.ContributionItem.getParent() did not specify that it could return null. This was an oversight that has been addressed in Eclipse 3.1 with Javadoc for the method clarifying when it can return null. For more details, see bug 92777. Action required: Any code calling ContributionItem.getParent() should ensure that it can handle a null result. Kevin gave the +1 for the change. Verified in I20050509-2010.
Bug.WithOutStack: build I20050420 ContributionItem.getParent() is spec'ed to not return null: /** * Returns the parent contribution manager. * * @return the parent contribution manager * @since 2.0 */ public IContributionManager getParent() ... However, it can return null if the item has not yet been added to a contribution manager (this has always been true), or after it has been removed from the manager (true since 3.1 due to fix for bug 80569). Need to change the spec to clarify that it can return null. /** * Returns the parent contribution manager, or null if this contribution * item is not currently added to a contribution manager. * * @return the parent contribution manager, or null * @since 2.0 */ Added the following to the porting guide: ContributionItem.getParent() can return null What is affected: Plug-ins that call getParent() on a subclass of org.eclipse.jface.action.ContributionItem. Description: In Eclipse 3.0, method org.eclipse.jface.action.ContributionItem.getParent() did not specify that it could return null. This was an oversight that has been addressed in Eclipse 3.1 with Javadoc for the method clarifying when it can return null. For more details, see bug 92777. Action required: Any code calling ContributionItem.getParent() should ensure that it can handle a null result. Kevin gave the +1 for the change. Verified in I20050509-2010.

Bug.Summery: F1 Help on preference pages doesn't work
Bug.WithStack:
If you do a F1 help on the preference page you should get a help window containing the old Help context popup. We currently do not (using Eclipse build from 0415 (about 1 week after M6).
To reproduce: create a C project. Open properties on it. Select info then press F1. You will get a help window. select any other preference entry and the help will follow -- except if you select a CDT provided entry. It looks like we are missing a few things with the linkage to help.
When we select the property page and the help system is open, we should update the help (something called dynamic help). We don't
If we select an individual item on our property pages (such as a single error parser) then the f1 will work. However if nothing on the page is selected then F1 does not work. Created attachment 20954 update the make.ui help Created attachment 20955 update the managedbuilder help Created attachment 20956 update the ui help (not quite complete -- see next note) I have attached three patches to enable the F1 help.
I have a bit of a problem with the method TabFolderOptionBlock.showHelp(). What I am trying to do is link into the "automagic" help that the platform has introduced. If the help window is open, and you select something in the ui, the help window will switch to appropriate help. I am able to open the appropriate help always, I cannot seem to make it conditional on the help window already being open. I am hoping for a comment on my approach :-) Hopefully it is something simple.
To test this patch, just open Window->preferences on the new make project and select F1. You should see a side window with help -- if you select alternate tabs (except the Environment one) the help will update. I have also opened a question type defect on the platform help 92922.
Bug.WithOutStack:
If you do a F1 help on the preference page you should get a help window containing the old Help context popup. We currently do not (using Eclipse build from 0415 (about 1 week after M6).
To reproduce: create a C project. Open properties on it. Select info then press F1. You will get a help window. select any other preference entry and the help will follow -- except if you select a CDT provided entry. It looks like we are missing a few things with the linkage to help.
When we select the property page and the help system is open, we should update the help (something called dynamic help). We don't
If we select an individual item on our property pages (such as a single error parser) then the f1 will work. However if nothing on the page is selected then F1 does not work. Created attachment 20954 update the make.ui help Created attachment 20955 update the managedbuilder help Created attachment 20956 update the ui help (not quite complete -- see next note) I have attached three patches to enable the F1 help.
I have a bit of a problem with the method TabFolderOptionBlock.showHelp(). What I am trying to do is link into the "automagic" help that the platform has introduced. If the help window is open, and you select something in the ui, the help window will switch to appropriate help. I am able to open the appropriate help always, I cannot seem to make it conditional on the help window already being open. I am hoping for a comment on my approach :-) Hopefully it is something simple.
To test this patch, just open Window->preferences on the new make project and select F1. You should see a side window with help -- if you select alternate tabs (except the Environment one) the help will update. I have also opened a question type defect on the platform help 92922.

Bug.Summery: [Parser] LocationMap#createASTMacroDefinition needs to set ASTObjectMacro's parent
Bug.WithStack:
In LocationMap#createASTMacroDefinition(_MacroDefinition): after r.setName(name); there needs to also be: r.setParent(rootNode);
This way an ASTMacroName's parent, an ASTMacroObject, will have the TU as it's parent instead of null... which causes it to work the same way other IASTNames do with open declaration. Agreed! Currently this is done only in getPreprocessorStatements() but the macro expansions can cause macro defs to be created at different times. Fix applied to HEAD.
Bug.WithOutStack:
In LocationMap#createASTMacroDefinition(_MacroDefinition): after r.setName(name); there needs to also be: r.setParent(rootNode);
This way an ASTMacroName's parent, an ASTMacroObject, will have the TU as it's parent instead of null... which causes it to work the same way other IASTNames do with open declaration. Agreed! Currently this is done only in getPreprocessorStatements() but the macro expansions can cause macro defs to be created at different times. Fix applied to HEAD.

Bug.Summery: [Repo View] Add Change Sets to remote compare
Bug.WithStack:
When you run comparison between current workspace and CVS tag/version the results can be shown in synchronize view and you can also use "Change Set" feature to get better groupping of the comparison results.
However if you open CVS Repositories view, select two versions/tags from there and run "Compare" action it will show results in the editor and not in the dialog and not in the Synchronize view. As a result it does not provide groupping by "Cahnge Set". Please add an option to use Synchronize view for comparison between two CVS tags/versions. By design, the synchronize view shows the synchronization state between the local workspace and the server. The comparison you mention is between two remote trees. However, the nature of your request is still valid. You wish to have the ability to see change sets in the tree viewer that is shown in the remote compare editor. *** Bug 102620 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
When you run comparison between current workspace and CVS tag/version the results can be shown in synchronize view and you can also use "Change Set" feature to get better groupping of the comparison results.
However if you open CVS Repositories view, select two versions/tags from there and run "Compare" action it will show results in the editor and not in the dialog and not in the Synchronize view. As a result it does not provide groupping by "Cahnge Set". Please add an option to use Synchronize view for comparison between two CVS tags/versions. By design, the synchronize view shows the synchronization state between the local workspace and the server. The comparison you mention is between two remote trees. However, the nature of your request is still valid. You wish to have the ability to see change sets in the tree viewer that is shown in the remote compare editor. *** Bug 102620 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The directory to apply the patch : /org.eclipse.ui.workbench/Eclipse UI/org/eclipse/ui/internal/dialogs/FilteredPreferenceDialog.java Created attachment 20685 A patch to disable combo when there's only one or zero page in the preference dialog

Bug.Summery: Help will not display
Bug.WithStack:

I get an Internet Explorer window saying "page cannot be displayed", even though I told Eclipse to use Firefox and to display it externally. I can get no combination of settings to actually display help files.
I am using the 3.1 build I downloaded on 4/25/05 (I think M6). This could be a problem with help browsers, or with help server. Can you try latest builds. Can you at least display help from Help->Help Contents menu? If browser launch but not display help, please attach eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.tomcat\catalina.*.log Also please check eclipse readme - the help section. I can see the contents menu. But when I click on any item, nothing happens. Doesn't the beta update the build when you click on update? When I try to display the topic, I get:
Action canceled Internet Explorer was unable to link to the Web page you requested. The page might be temporarily unavailable.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Click the Refresh button, or try again later.
If you have visited this page previously and you want to view what has been stored on your computer, click File, and then click Work Offline.
For information about offline browsing with Internet Explorer, click the Help menu, and then click Contents and Index.
---------------------------------- Why does Eclipse use Internet Explorer when my default browser is Firefox, and I do not want IE to be used for anything????

The log you asked for is small: WebappLoader[]: Deploying class repositories to work directory C:\Documents and Settings\jar\My Documents\ORAU\projects\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.tomcat\ROOT WebappLoader[]: Deploying class repositories to work directory C:\Documents and Settings\jar\My Documents\ORAU\projects\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.tomcat\ROOT

Do you have anything 'interesting' configured on your machine that does not come with the 'out of the box' XP? Help uses localhost and tomcat server to serve pages to the browser. Your dns messages are strange - do you have security settings that disable localhost? I have everything under the sun on my machine including Tomcat and Apache. I went through the README file. I use a static ip address. I changed the server port to 1111. But netstat -a does not reveal a listener there!
I also changed the browser to be Firefox, but the help window still shows IE.
Also, if I click the dynamic help, no window appears. The only way I get to help is to click search and then use the links at the bottom to display all help topics.
3.0 help works fine. What changed?
Now I get Action canceled Internet Explorer was unable to link to the Web page you requested. The page might be temporarily unavailable.
I added localhost to my zonealarm trusted sites too. *** Bug 99544 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** catalina.*.log from comment #1?
People reported issues with McAfee 10. Your version is different, but you may want to check bug 87371 anyway. Sorry. I missed your adding the log in comment #5. The normal log has more entries, so there is a problem starting Tomcat and deploying help webapp.
Please check workspace/.metadata/.log for errors. Also, try running Eclipse with a freshly installed copy of JRE (pass a path to the new jre using "-vm - path/to/java.exe"). Must I start Tomcat for help to work? It is usually off. Does Eclipse have its own Tomcat in it? I have my own version installed.
I have found the right log, so I attach it. Plesae, remove XML (xerces) jars from JRE installation (not just rename) and help should launch. The log shows problem loading parser implementation.
Eclipse contains subset of Tomcat in org.eclipse.tomcat plug-in for use by Help. It is started by help when help is launched. No need to start any other Tomcat. That worked! Many thanks.
However, that makes life hard for other a[pplications that nee XML parsing. XML parsing support is now part of JDK through JAXP - other applications should use JAXP.

Bug.Summery: [Change Sets] New files in Unassigned bucket when coparing with a tag
Bug.WithStack:
I have CVS repository the is working fine with "Change Sets" when I pickup new changes from HEAD. However when I run comparison of the workspace and CVS tag with "Change Sets" it shows lots of "Unassigned Remote Changes". Also when I choose action "Open Change in Compare Editor" for many of those shanges it says that change is new, which is incorrect information. What CVS server verasion are you using? I think it is: Concurrent Versions System (CVS) 1.11.5 (client/server)
Also here is fragment of the console log with valid requests and responses:
Valid-responses ok error M E Checked-in Valid-requests Template Set-sticky Clear-static-directory Module-expansion Set-static-directory Clear-sticky New-entry Merged Removed Updated Remove-entry Update-existing Copy-file Created Notified Mod-time valid-requests Valid-requests Root Valid-responses valid-requests Repository Directory Max-dotdot Static-directory Sticky Checkin-prog Update-prog Entry Kopt Checkin-time Modified Is-modified UseUnchanged Unchanged Notify Questionable Case Argument Argumentx Global_option Gzip-streamwrapper-sendme-rcsOptions Set expand-modules ci co update diff log rlog add remove update-patches gzip-file-contents status rdiff tag rtag import admin export history release watch-on watch-off watch-add watch-remove watchers editors init annotate rannotate noop version ok
This works for me when comaring projects from dev.eclipse.org. Can you try loading the org.eclipse.team.cvs.core project from :pserver:anonymous@dev.eclipse.org:/home/eclipse and comparing it with a previous date to see if it works. If so, that will tell use whether it is a server version issue. I compared that module to I20050124 tag (first one I picked randomly) and got few files under "Unassigned Remote Changes". All of those files are marked as "+". I am able to reproduce that. I didn't have any new changes in the comparison I did. The changes in the "Unassigned Remote Changes" bucket are all files that were added since the tag was created. There seems to be a problem getting the comment for these cases.
In your previous comment, you said you were getting the + on files that were not new since the tag was created. Is this true (i.e. is there two problems here or just one). (In reply to comment #5) > I am able to reproduce that. I didn't have any new changes in the comparison I > did. The changes in the "Unassigned Remote Changes" bucket are all files that > were added since the tag was created. There seems to be a problem getting the > comment for these cases.
It seems that the same issue exists if file had been removed.
Also, if you have uncommitted change on some file it also fail to pull the history on it (they are also appear under unassigned changes).
> In your previous comment, you said you were getting the + on files that were > not new since the tag was created. Is this true (i.e. is there two problems > here or just one).
Yes. For some changed files under "Unassigned Remote changes" (I have lots of just changed files) if I pick "Open Change in Copare Editor" from popup menu - left panel is empty and label says "File is New". Would it be possibel for you to provide me with a set of steps to reproduce the "File is new" problem? (In reply to comment #7) > Would it be possibel for you to provide me with a set of steps to reproduce > the "File is new" problem?
Something like this:
-- Run comparison to CVS tag. -- Find a changed file (it should not be added or deleted) under "Unassigned Remote Changes" node (double click on this change will show the differnces in editor). -- In popup menu select "Open Change in Comapre Editor" -- Select changed file (in my case it has "+" icon already) and you'll see that left panel is empty and its label says "File is New".
Actually, what I am asking for is an exact set of steps to reproduce. That is, I will need to know the steps (and conditions) that will cause the changed file to appear in the Unassignd" bucket. I know it is sometimes difficult to identify all the factors that are needed to reproduce the problem but without them there is nothing I can do (unless I get lucky and stumble on the same conditions myself). I'll see if I can find such case in your module.

Please try stepping up to Eclipse 3.1M6, VE 1.1M1 (it was just released yesterday) , plus the EMF and GEF that are pointed to on the VE download page. It looks like there is a mismatch between the version of Eclipse and VE development drivers. closing since we have no new info as to still a problem. closing. Reopen please if still a problem.

Bug.Summery: Drag-n-drop from Synchronize view to CVS resource history don't work for the incoming CVS change
Bug.WithStack: Drag-n-drop from Synchronize view to CVS resource history don't work for the incoming CVS change if this change is representing newly added resource. Also, show in resource history action is disabled for such resource which is invalid because it is already in CVS. *** Bug 42726 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** This was fixed in 3.2.
Bug.WithOutStack: Drag-n-drop from Synchronize view to CVS resource history don't work for the incoming CVS change if this change is representing newly added resource. Also, show in resource history action is disabled for such resource which is invalid because it is already in CVS. *** Bug 42726 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** This was fixed in 3.2.

Bug.Summery: Missing files
Bug.WithStack: I downloaded and installed wtp-wst-1.0M3.zip. But when I start Eclipse, there are missing files I cannot obtain. ftp://www-126.ibm.com/ seems very dead mail.jar and activation.jar do not seem to be in the soap 2.3.1 package In M4 (due out very soon), this so-called "third party" jar issue is resolved. The Apache SOAP plugin is gone along with its requirement for mail.jar and activation.jar, as is servlet.jar from the Axis plugin. All other jars are included now in M4. Thanks - CB. This has been fixed I did confirm this as fixed Thank you. closing since verified.
Bug.WithOutStack: I downloaded and installed wtp-wst-1.0M3.zip. But when I start Eclipse, there are missing files I cannot obtain. ftp://www-126.ibm.com/ seems very dead mail.jar and activation.jar do not seem to be in the soap 2.3.1 package In M4 (due out very soon), this so-called "third party" jar issue is resolved. The Apache SOAP plugin is gone along with its requirement for mail.jar and activation.jar, as is servlet.jar from the Axis plugin. All other jars are included now in M4. Thanks - CB. This has been fixed I did confirm this as fixed Thank you. closing since verified.

Bug.Summery: [IBinding] IVariable accepted where IType expected (C)
Bug.WithStack:
void f() { int x=1, y=3; x * y; //A }
If Line A is parsed as an declaration statement, and the IASTName's bindings are resolved to CVariables. I would expect an IProblemBinding given the layout of the physical tree, as a variable is not a type. done. we report problems when: an IASTIdExpression is a type an ICASTTypedefNameSpecifier is not a type an IASTTypeId has a declSpec that is not a type
Bug.WithOutStack:
void f() { int x=1, y=3; x * y; //A }
If Line A is parsed as an declaration statement, and the IASTName's bindings are resolved to CVariables. I would expect an IProblemBinding given the layout of the physical tree, as a variable is not a type. done. we report problems when: an IASTIdExpression is a type an ICASTTypedefNameSpecifier is not a type an IASTTypeId has a declSpec that is not a type

Access Declarations not handled

Bug.Summery: Copy and paste totally broken
Bug.WithStack:
Normally, I can use ctrl-c/ctrl-v or the copy and paste menu to copy one phrase of code and paste it somewhere else in the Java file (using the Java editor). Today, that functionality stopped working completely without any obvious error messages.
Typically this failure would happen after Eclipse had been running for a week or so. I would exit and restart Eclipse and the functionality would return. However, today it did not return. Tried running "eclipse -clean" and deleting ~/.eclipse to see if that would unstick copy and paste, but it did not. It seems the only other place that it might be broken is in the .metadata directory, but I have no idea where to look and don't want to lose all my preferences and projects by deleting it.
I've attached the directory for your debugging convience (as soon as I figure out how to attach it).
Thank you for your help.
Sincerely, Stephen McCants Even if I bzip2 -9 the metadata directory it is still 2.7 megs, so I cannot attach it (it is larger than 2 megs). Let me know what you need from the metadata directory. This might be a variant of bug 64507. Lowering severity, because closing the editor and reopening the file fixes the problem (see bug 64507). Not sure why closing Eclipse and restarting it won't fix it but closing the editor does. Please provide more info. See also: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-text-home/development/bug-incomplete.htm * Build id - 200409161125 * VM information - 1.4.2 IBM AIX build ca1420-20040626 * are there related entries in the .log file? Not that I could find. * attached preferences - Not that I'm aware of * specify the concrete editor for editor bugs - Java Editor as mentioned below * try to provide steps to reproduce the problem and attach test resources (if possible) - no idea... it just happens. * tell us if you write code against J2SE 5.0 i.e. compiler compliance level set to 1.5? - no
Looks like a duplicate of bug 74240. Could be, but there is one difference. This is on AIX and so does not have the "klipper" application. In answer to the question in bug 74240 :
"Window -> Preferences -> Java -> Editor -> Typing -> Update imports on paste" turned on?
Yes, it was turned on. I've since turned it off to see if the problem remanifests itself. Hope that helps some. There are other applications that behave the same way as klipper. Do you have any applications that let you access clipbopard history? Do you use xclip? It is also possible that applications like OpenOffice may store clipboard history and cause an interaction problem. Not that I am aware of. (I run GNOME, but not gnone-clipboard-daemon. I do not use OO on AIX.) Now that you have been running a while with "Update imports on paste" do you still see this problem? No, I have not seen the bug since. Good, marking as a duplicate of bug 74240 then.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 74240 ***

Bug.Summery: local history latest saved version not available for comparison

Lines.Line: 1) The diff session should be runnable against the in memory version or the
latest saved version. Perhaps two versions of the command should exist that
explicitly say "compare latest saved with local history" and "compare with
local history", which would imply the in-memory resource.
2) The latest saved version should be shown as the topmost entry in the
history list. It could be grey if the in-memory resource has not changed. But
if the resource has changed, then the latest saved is actually a legitimate
version for comparison. This is the only way to be able to answer the
question "what have I changed since I last saved?" Right now, I don't think
that question can be answered with this facility. Even saving it and then
checking does not help because we don't have incremental comparison (see my
other Bugzilla from today."

Bug.WithStack:
I created a sample model on 24 April (for an article) that had four versions saved. I'd like to embed a screen shot here, but I'll just have to render it in text. The local history versions list looks like:
** April 24, 2005 ** 12:08:17 PM ** 12:01:19 PM ** 12:00:45 PM ** 12:00:43 PM
Today (26 April), I continued working with the sample (writing an article) and saved the model twice more. I expected this history list:
** April 26, 2005 ** 11:32:31 AM ** 11:30:36 AM ** April 24, 2005 ** 12:08:17 PM ** 12:01:19 PM ** 12:00:45 PM ** 12:00:43 PM
but instead, I see:
** April 26, 2005 ** 11:32:31 AM ** April 24, 2005 ** 12:08:36 PM <==== wrong date/time!!! ** 12:08:17 PM ** 12:01:19 PM ** 12:00:45 PM ** 12:00:43 PM
The 12:08:36 PM version is actually the first one I saved today and the date and time are completely bogus. I've seen this before, but thought I was seeing things. Here, I have screen shots in my article that clearly show that this is happening. Ok ... never mind my initial explanation ... brain fart. I realized a moment ago what I was seeing. The version that is showing up as the final version the other day is, in fact, correct. It was created exactly when history says it was. My confusion arose from the fact that the currently saved version is suppressed in the history display. So I was always comparing the last saved (and current) version in my editor with the previously saved version.
I experimented to see what it does when the current version in the workspace has been changed but not saved. Of course it compares the latest saved version with the previously saved version. This is implicit in the fact that the command is issued against the resource, so the in-memory version can be ignored I suppose.
The problem is that this is intuitive only to the person who designed and wrote the local history interface. Ignoring the current version in memory just does not make sense when the currently saved version is not even displayed in the history window.
So here are some suggestions:
1) The diff session should be runnable against the in memory version or the latest saved version. Perhaps two versions of the command should exist that explicitly say "compare latest saved with local history" and "compare with local history", which would imply the in-memory resource.
2) The latest saved version should be shown as the topmost entry in the history list. It could be grey if the in-memory resource has not changed. But if the resource has changed, then the latest saved is actually a legitimate version for comparison. This is the only way to be able to answer the question "what have I changed since I last saved?" Right now, I don't think that question can be answered with this facility. Even saving it and then checking does not help because we don't have incremental comparison (see my other Bugzilla from today."
My point here is that the current facility is very much non-intuitive because it does not allow two key questions to be answered:
1) What is different between the in-memory version and the latest saved version; and
2) What did I changed between each pair of historical versions? Local history was combined with remote history in 3.2 and is shown in the History view. Feel free to reopen if you feel that any of your points still apply to the new layout.

Bug.Summery: Icon for CVS-related views are not verbose enough
Bug.WithStack:
Since repositories/history/annotate views does not allow to combine all existing repository types, current icons does not reflect functionality. Please add a little "CVS" label to all these icons (similar to the label you see on icons for repository provider types in sunchronize wizard). It will make easier to see where view is belong to. It is even more important when views are used in "Quick View" mode and you have more then one SVN provider (e.g. CVS and Subversion) I don't think we are planning to do an icon refresh in 3.1 but we will consider this when we do. If it help, I can prepare CVS icons with labels. To ensure consistency in the platform, we get all the artwork done by the same source. I just took a quick look at the subversion plugin and noticed that they copied the CVS icons. That seems to me to be the real problem here. Perhaps you could ask them to change there's to be unique. I think it is still a good idea to consider labeling the CVS icons but I don't consider it a high priority. We do not plan on addressing this issue. We already have a set of icons for CVS views that are meant to be distinct. Sorry, I didn't complete that last thought. The CVS icons are fairly distinct but unfortunately often get copied. That i really an issue for the copier not the CVS plugin. There are 3 views: CVS annotate, CVS Editors and CVS repositories. At least "repositories" view is fairly generic and really hard not to copy. Please reconsider to make it look more CVS-specific (e.g. like icon used for CVS-related jobs). I have all of Callisto loaded and there is not one view that uses text to indicate anything about what the view contains. If someone wants to copy a CVS icon, it would be up to them to differentiate it somehow. (In reply to comment #7) > I have all of Callisto loaded and there is not one view that uses text to > indicate anything about what the view contains. If someone wants to copy a CVS > icon, it would be up to them to differentiate it somehow.
Michael, I understand that, but it is also platform responsibility to not encourage sych copying. Again, text is already used for job icons, so, why not for repositories? Though I will be happy to see any other recognisable marker used across all CVS-related icons. So, it is probably more question to the person responsible for overall Eclipse UI... That sounds reasonable. I've copied the Lead of the UI team. I'm happy to go with his recommendation. McQ, do you think we should change all the CVS view icons to contain the text "cvs" somewhere to make the CVS view icons distinguishable in the case where another tool has copied the CVS icons? Adding text to icons just seems bogus to me. I'm not even particularly happy with the current uses of this in the IDE (e.g. the "J" on java projects). The real problem here is that someone has copied our icons. They're certainly *allowed* to do it, but if it's causing grief for people we should let them know.
Having said that, only a small number of our users actually run with connections to multiple repository types, so I suspect it isn't that big a deal. I am afraid you underestimate actual number of users. Besides, even those users don't use CVS, they still have CVS icons visible in Eclipse because CVS plugin is part of the platform.
Anyways, if you don't like textual label on those icons, why don't use pictographic marker to make them look different?
Bug.WithOutStack:
Since repositories/history/annotate views does not allow to combine all existing repository types, current icons does not reflect functionality. Please add a little "CVS" label to all these icons (similar to the label you see on icons for repository provider types in sunchronize wizard). It will make easier to see where view is belong to. It is even more important when views are used in "Quick View" mode and you have more then one SVN provider (e.g. CVS and Subversion) I don't think we are planning to do an icon refresh in 3.1 but we will consider this when we do. If it help, I can prepare CVS icons with labels. To ensure consistency in the platform, we get all the artwork done by the same source. Bug.Summery: Comments on new Open Type Dialog

Lines.Line: - when the dialog pops up the history is still MRU
- as soon as a pattern exists (user started typing) the history is sorted, but
still separated from the types returned form search history
- I made blank the end character as well. So if you want to go to "SWT" you can
type "SWT " which only leaves SWT in the list
- regarding lower case camel case: I looked into this but this isn't doable with
out making the search engine aware of camel case. The reason is that pattern
entered in the open type dialog is case insensitive. However to not have to
many matches in a camel case search I have to make the pattern case
sensitive. Other search for npe would mean search for n*p*e* which results in
far to many matches and sorting them will take longer since I have to
compute a category. So to limit the number of matches in the first place I
search for N*P*E* case sensitive which gives far less matches.

Bug.WithStack:
[off-topic] it's interesting to see how things evolve. for example, the all-types-cache was originally created exactly for this very dialog. :-) I would like to see the history sorted alphabetically. I think the Camel Case pattern support is a good idea, but it would be better if I didn't have to use caps : 'lhm' should also select 'LinkedHashMap'. I haven't seen the new dialog yet but histories are generally displayed in date/time order. But when the rest of the dialog sorts the types names alphabetically, having the history sorted differently makes it harder to find a type.
You end up typing more of the name that you should have to. Here is the state of what is going into tonights integration build:
- when the dialog pops up the history is still MRU - as soon as a pattern exists (user started typing) the history is sorted, but still separated from the types returned form search history - I made blank the end character as well. So if you want to go to "SWT" you can type "SWT " which only leaves SWT in the list - regarding lower case camel case: I looked into this but this isn't doable with out making the search engine aware of camel case. The reason is that pattern entered in the open type dialog is case insensitive. However to not have to many matches in a camel case search I have to make the pattern case sensitive. Other search for npe would mean search for n*p*e* which results in far to many matches and sorting them will take longer since I have to compute a category. So to limit the number of matches in the first place I search for N*P*E* case sensitive which gives far less matches.
*** Bug 93781 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 94140 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** (In reply to comment #6) > - regarding lower case camel case: I looked into this but this isn't doable with > out making the search engine aware of camel case. The reason is that pattern > entered in the open type dialog is case insensitive. However to not have to > many matches in a camel case search I have to make the pattern case > sensitive. Other search for npe would mean search for n*p*e* which results in > far to many matches and sorting them will take longer since I have to > compute a category. So to limit the number of matches in the first place I > search for N*P*E* case sensitive which gives far less matches.
Dirk, can't you search bot both patterns "^lhm*" and "L*H*M*" when user entered lover case "lhm"? That shouldn't require changes in search engine. See comment #1 in 93781. I already looked into this. (In reply to comment #10) > See comment #1 in 93781. I already looked into this.
I thought that Lucene allows to combine multiple search terms within one search query. Is there limitation in a current type search? Playing a bit more with this dialog, I noticed that the search became case-sensitive if the first character of the pattern is a capital letter.
If I type 'cl' or 'cL', I get java.lang.Class in the list of matching types, but if I type 'CL', I don't get java.lang.Class.
This limitation was not in 3.0. The pattern is only case sensitive if you type a sequence of upper case letter followed by only lower case letters (for example ImAge matches Image). This is needed for the camel case thing.
I agree that this wasn't the case in the old dialog but not doing so means giving up on camel case patterns. We are not using Lucene for the Java index. It is a blooper that the package qualification for unique types is shown only when I select the raw in the list. That is: if it's unselected it looks like ChangeQueue but when selected it's ChangeQueue - org.eclipse.jface.viewers.deferred This is unexpected. > It is a blooper...
Maybe so, but you are seeing as much or more info than in 3.0. now this one is a bug (lost functionality): I have 2 JDKs in my workspace (1.4 and 1.5) I wanted to have a look at the source of Vector in both. It used to show me that it was available in 2 JDKs, now it just shows me the package it comes from (after selecting it arbitrary chooses the first one)
Dirk, should I enter a separate report? - this is major for me. Adam, which build are you using.
This works for me. See the attached screen shot. Do you have a constallation where Vector isn't fully qualified. Created attachment 21347 Screen shot Adam, are all classes from your "second" JDK missing or only Vector. If so then this sounds more like a search engine bug not reporting all matches anymore. sorry, my bad. I had the JDK set up allright, but no project was using it. silly me. disregard. Dirk, is it possible to put classes that has source available as part of workspace projects before classes that came from jar files or some attached sources? I like the speed of the new Open Type dialog (except for the initial indexing phase) but the old user interface was consistent with Open Resource (Navigate > Open Resource..., Ctrl+Shift+R) and Go To Resource (Navigate > Go To > Resource...). Are these going to change too?
Platform/UI is looking if they can adapt to the new layout (see bug 94382). this is very minor but I'd change the TZ=TimeZone into something different. Someone might be fooled into thinking that TimeZone actually refers to something about time. How is LHS=LinkedHashSet? another problem: I was playing today with many projects, opening and closing them. It seems that opening a project is not enough for the indexer to re-put the project's type into the index. After I open the project, its types are still not visible! Only rebuilding helps. Nothing in the log. When the dialog opens it says that it's updating the indices. But even after it's done, the types are still not visible. Adam,
- regarding TZ. A previous version of the dialog used LHM and I was asked to change this since not many programmers now that there is a LinkedHashMap ;-)
- regarding open projects please see bug 95895. Regarding comment #22: you should get this after a while for types you already opened since they will go into the history (assuming that you are more interested in the source types than the binary). In the workspace list I think it is better to stick to a alphabetic sorting. (In reply to comment #28) > Regarding comment #22: you should get this after a while for types you already > opened since they will go into the history (assuming that you are more > interested in the source types than the binary). In the workspace list I think > it is better to stick to a alphabetic sorting.
It is not about history, but jut regular case. The thing is that I'm using Maven and all classes are placed to Maven repository, so there are lot of jars created from workspace projects and they all appear on top of the list in open type dialog. *** Bug 95917 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Dirk, a heads up (don't know how to reproduce in a small workspace) some types are just not visible in the new dialog. (this time I did not close/reopen anything). For some reason they're just not there.
I've been using Open Resource a lot lately because of this bug. Open Type in M7 works for me half of the time. Adam, since the dialog is now using the search engine directly it would be helpful if you can do the following when it happens: do a search for type declaration using the name you are looking for using the nornal search dialog. If search doesn't find the type declaration either then the bug is in the search engine.
Adam, if you using lots for external jars you might want to CC yourself to https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=93668 which describes a scenario where the search indices are not rebuilt resulting in missing types in the dialog. Thanks Dirk. No luck. The search finds the type no problem. It's just missing from the dialog. That's M7 vanilla (sorry to spam everyone :)) one more thing - this is a source class, not from a jar. Can you zip your workspace ? I will close this one. If you still see problems with the Open Type dialog in RC1, please file individual bug reports.

Bug.Summery: [Actions] Add Compare with Previous
Bug.WithStack:
Compare with local history can be a useful facility for seeing the static difference between one or more historical versions and the local version in the workspace. But very soon after first using the local history feature, one notices that the real value in saving incremental versions is in following the incremental changes to see where a mistake was made. Unfortunately, the current local history feature does not offer the "display incremental comparison" feature, so the user cannot really use it for anything but finding a specific point in history.
The only operation that can be performed on a historical version is to replace the local copy, and one need not use compare with local history to find that version, because a new replace with ... session is needed to actually perform the replacement anyway.
I suggest that the main value of the compare with variant of the feature would be a safe (read only) exploration tool and that the most valuable form of exploration is looking at incremental change. Kim, I'm not quite sure what you are asking for. One thing we did in 3.2 is move the local history (forthe most part) into the history view. This makes it possible for the user to select two previous versions of the local history and compare them. Is this what you were looking for or was it something more? (In reply to comment #1) > Kim, I'm not quite sure what you are asking for. One thing we did in 3.2 is > move the local history (forthe most part) into the history view. This makes it > possible for the user to select two previous versions of the local history and > compare them. Is this what you were looking for or was it something more?
That is basically the same thing I am asking for. When I use local history, I am either looking for a specific version, or I am looking at incremental changes. So I can image the current mode, and a mode where I can click any version and see only the changes between that version and the previous one ... basically a shortcut for what you are mentioning. The addition of a toggle would allow that behavior if there is any interest.
Sheesh ... make that "I can imagine the current ..." We already have two modes for double click: open selected or compare selected with local. Havign a three way toggle is more complicated. However, it would be worthwhile to have a key-bindable menu-item for a Compare with Previous operation. In 3.2, local history compare was moved to the history view and you can now compare incremental changes
